blocking_issues.description: correctness issues that corrupt data. Specifically, `HistoryCompressor._truncate_to_tokens` destroys whitespace and indentation (critical for code context) by splitting on whitespace and re-joining. Additionally, the compressor mishandles dictionary-based messages (common in LLM stacks) by defaulting to `str(d)`, resulting in noisy context. Finally, the token budget logic ensures unintended truncation because block defaults plus wrapper overhead exceed the total budget."
